div.div: EOCCS Public Health Related Closure Plan

br.div: As the number of confirmed cases of Coronavirus in New Jersey continues to rise, the possibility of more K12 school closures is increasing. East Orange Community Charter School (EOCCS) has taken multiple steps to protect the health and safety of our students and staff. These steps include distance learning preparation for all K-4th grade students. As of today, EOCCS is closed to students on Monday, March 16, 2020, for additional planning and deep cleaning of our facilities. As we continue to finalize virtual plans, the State Department of Education has asked us to complete and submit our Public Health-Related Closure Plan. Please see the plan details below. If you have any questions, direct them to the school interim principal, Ms. Watkins.

Accountability and Assessment: procedures assigned (i.e. video of student responses, completed worksheets, written responses submitted, anecdotal notes or pictures of student work uploaded/provided by the parent, etc.).

Student Attendance: Teachers/TAs will be directed to take attendance daily via Google Classroom and through students’ participation in online applications such as RAZ Kids and Splash Math. Students check-in and show evidence of being signed on for daily attendance. If a student is going to be absent from a virtual class, the parent needs to notify the school by contacting the main office phone number as usual. Daily attendance will be pulled into the SIS daily as per the usual procedure. Family Liaisons will make an effort to reach out to parents of students with extended “absences” and report concerns to the principal.

Communication and Delivery: Google Classroom will be the primary means of communication between home and school. Through Google Classroom, teachers will decide the best method to provide lessons and related materials, such as interactive lessons from HMH, Benchmark, RAZ Kids, Splash Math, as well as assessments. During the week of March 9, 2020, teachers provided information to students on where and how to access their lessons and content.

Differentiation: Lessons and methodology will be based on age and developmental levels. Planning by grade-level teams started during the week of March 9, 2020. The inclusion teachers were involved in this planning and have been added as co-teachers in Google Classroom. They will provide modified assignments based on the lead teacher’s plans. Modifications and accommodations appropriate per IEPs and 504 plans, as well as I&RS Action Plans and tiered intervention supports, will be provided through additional scaffolding documents and conversations via feed and video by teachers.

Independent Practice: Follow up practice activities and assignments provided through Google Classroom, email, etc. Reading/text assignments and project-based learning assignments provided to students.

Instruction: Online lessons provided to students to watch (i.e. recorded videos by teachers, links to online videos, lessons through specific instructional platforms, live sessions (recorded for equitable access), text, and research).

Resources: Each teacher has selected the resources appropriate to their students, content and learning objectives, many of which are linked to their daily curricular resources. Some resources include: HMH Into Math, Science and Social Studies, RAZ Kids, Slash Math, Benchmark, etc.

div.b: Equitable Access to Instruction for All Students:

ul.li: The district issued a survey to all families and is in the process of identifying those without internet and/or devices at home. Accommodations to provide alternate access to instructional content (i.e. provide other paper-based assignments in advance and via mail) are being developed.
ELL Teachers will be responsible for providing distance learning opportunities appropriate for their students.
504 accommodations are to be provided as relevant to the distance learning activities.
Accommodations as appropriate per I&RS Action Plans and tiered intervention supports.

While it is not expected, teachers may invite students to live lessons, but shouldn’t require students to participate in a live lesson. Any live lesson content will be recorded or summarized in some format for those who can’t participate live.
Principal to communicate via Google Classroom and email, all messages to staff.
IT Network Administrator to provide teachers with technical support through the existing ticketing system. Additionally, he will provide assistance on how to:
Record a lesson on video to post
Access Google Classroom from home
Tutorials as needed and daily email ideas and suggestions

Supervisors and teachers to identify tech apps, sites, platforms and links to utilize for lessons. All certificated staff created a Google Classroom(s) and added their immediate supervisor and principal as instructors.

Staff will continue to utilize the school-specific Google Classroom that will be used by the Principal to communicate and to take daily staff attendance. Staff illnesses and personal days will still be requested via the current process with notification to Ms. Bray or Ms. Payan. Ms. Payan will continue to issue the daily absence report. Sub plans for students will need to be provided for students by the assigned teacher, and posted in the Google Classroom.

Teachers will have flexibility in instructional approaches, based on the needs of their students and program. However, students require direct learning experiences planned exclusively for them by their teacher(s) for all new content and will not be required to “self-teach” this new material.

Teachers should be available during their normal work hours with reasonable accommodations to flex their hours as needed, related to the circumstances of this unique situation (i.e. personal childcare/sickness, etc.).
Teachers will be flexible in due dates and/or timelines, and accommodate for the unique situations students may experience.
Daily attendance will be taken via Google Classroom by teachers (using the “mark as done” feature or some other developmentally appropriate strategy such as student participation in assignments).
School buildings will be closed for instruction, access, and extracurricular activities for staff and students unless specific arrangements are made through the Principal.
Administrators, supervisors and other ancillary staff will continue their professional responsibilities remotely and will be available during work hours to support teachers, students, and families.
Effective immediately, teachers to take district technology (Chromebooks, iPads, etc.) home each night including a power cord.
Google Classroom will be the primary mode of communication between home and school for all certificated staff.
A combination of multimedia and print approach will be taken.
Teachers should have essential instructional materials at home daily so they have immediate access for remote planning.
Teachers should direct students to take essential texts home daily or keep them at home (per teacher direction).
Teachers will provide instructional content for each class they teach, including direct lesson material and independent practice work.
Teachers will continue grading and providing student feedback in a timely manner.
As necessary, teachers should create alternate assignments or plans for students identified who do not have access to an internet connected computer at home.

Specialty teachers will maintain their own Google Classroom. They will share their Classroom code with the homeroom teacher. On the day of the specials, students will go to the Google Classroom of the specialty teacher to engage in their lessons for the day.

div.b: Special Education and Related Services for Students with Disabilities:

ul.li: Teachers will be responsible for attending IEP meetings via “Google Meet” as per already scheduled times.
Special Education Teachers will be responsible for providing distance learning opportunities appropriate for their students.

Title 1 and inclusion teachers should collaborate with their general education colleagues regarding the planning of appropriate modifications and instructional activities for students with IEPs, as well as Title 1 students.
Special Educators should provide distance learning opportunities that address the goals and objectives of the IEP.

div.b: Provision of School Nutrition Benefits for Eligible Students:

br.div: If requested to provide meals, our Food Service Management Company, Feeding Our Children is prepared to furnish bagged meals to eligible students. The backup Food Service company is Nu Way. The 99 Washington Street location would serve as the central pick up location.

ul.li: Google Classroom postings by 9AM for that day’s lessons.
Instruction and communication responsibilities will occur between 9AM - 1PM.
Planning and preparation may occur before 9AM and after 1PM.
Scheduled meetings (i.e. IEP) may take place during the normal school day.
Support your child(ren) in their learning process by:
Monitoring Google Classroom and checking in with your child(ren) daily about the continuous learning tasks, activities, and assessments that they are working on.
Asking your child(ren) about their assignments and supporting them, as needed, in submitting assignments in accordance with the established deadlines.
Designating an appropriate place where your child(ren) will work on assigned tasks.
Based on your child’s grade level, emailing teachers and/or reminding your child(ren) to email his/her teachers if they have any questions.
If your child(ren) experiences any issues with technology, please send a detailed message to your child’s teacher via class Dojo.
Engage in the remote learning experience responsibly and with integrity.
Check appropriate Google Classrooms and emails for information on courses,
assignments, and resources, on a daily basis.
Dedicate appropriate time to learning, as guided by your teachers.
Submit all assignments in accordance with provided timelines and/or due dates.
Identify a comfortable and quiet space to study/learn.
If you experience any issues with technology, please send a detailed message to your teacher via Class Dojo.
